title: MiniSB - MLB Homepage

All games that are returned must be of type "R"
All games must be from the date specified in the date parameter
All hydrations must be available in the structure of the response.
League IDs must match.
All teams are major league teams

title: Scoreboard - Scores Page (RETIRED AS REDUNDANT BY NEW SCOREBOARD SCENARIOS)
custom_steps: sportId=1,51&date=2019-07-18&gameTypes=E,S,R,A,F,D,L,W&hydrate=team(leaders(showOnPreview(leaderCategories=[homeRuns,runsBattedIn,battingAverage],statGroup=[pitching,hitting]))),linescore(matchup,runners),flags,liveLookin,review,broadcasts(all),decisions,person,probablePitcher,stats,homeRuns,previousPlay,game(content(media(featured,epg),summary),tickets),seriesStatus(useOverride=true)&useLatestGames=false&scheduleTypes=events,games&language=en&leagueIds=103,104,420
custom_expected:
All games displayed must be one of the following types: 
Exhibitiion
Spring Training
Regular Season
All Star Game
First Round Wild Card
Division Series
League Championship series

Date  should dictate which games show up (in other words, ASG will not show during the Same week as opening day or in June or after July.)

title: tiedGamesStandings
custom_steps:
Validate that if there are games on the given season that are actual ties, that we have actual matching scores for the home and visiting teams.  
Also make sure that the games are designated as tied, outside of the scores.

title: MLB Game is in Warmup
Gameday Preview
custom_preconds: For automation, we should have a clear map for storing our queryParameters and values.
custom_steps:
Set query parameters as specified in the following path:
schedule?gamePk=567509&language=en&hydrate=xrefId,lineups,broadcasts(all),probablePitcher(note),game(tickets)&useLatestGames=true&fields=dates,games,teams,probablePitcher,note,id,dates,games,broadcasts,type,name,homeAway,isNational,dates,games,game,tickets,ticketType,ticketLinks,dates,games,lineups,homePlayers,awayPlayers,useName,lastName,primaryPosition,abbreviation,dates,games,xrefIds,xrefId,xrefType

Sent an HTTP GET request to hostname (QA, PROD, BETA) with the query parameters specified.
custom_expected: All games will be MLB games (sportID 1). The game must match the one specified from the gamePk (567509). All hydrations must be available in the structure of the response. All teams are major league teams. All the fields related to the game are available in the structure of the response

title: Scoreboard - Check Game States (Preview, Live, Final)
custom_preconds: We'll send our standard request:  https://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/schedule?sportId=1,51&date=2019-08-18&gameTypes=E,S,R,A,F,D,L,W&hydrate=team(leaders(showOnPreview(leaderCategories=[homeRuns,runsBattedIn,battingAverage],statGroup=[pitching,hitting]))),linescore(matchup,runners),flags,liveLookin,review,broadcasts(all),decisions,person,probablePitcher,stats,homeRuns,previousPlay,game(content(media(featured,epg),summary),tickets),seriesStatus(useOverride=true)&useLatestGames=false&scheduleTypes=events,games&language=en&leagueIds=103,104,420. In order to get conditions that are indicative of game statuses we'd like to test (at least one of each Live, Preview, Final), we'll add &timecode=20190818_2015
custom_test_purpose: We're going to make sure that for the given date, we'll use the timecode to give us a series of games with each of the three gamestates.
custom_steps: Send GET request
custom_expected:
Status 200
On this date, there'll be a total of 34 Items:  19 events, 15 games and totalGamesInProgress of 10
For Preview - We should have game time in a standardized format (all game times should be in the same base time).
Live games - Game Time, inning and InningHalf
If Final, time zone requirement, and make sure that inning shows

title: Scoreboard - Game Type Regular Season
custom_preconds: We'll send our standard request:  https://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/schedule?sportId=1,51&date=2019-08-18&gameTypes=E,S,R,A,F,D,L,W&hydrate=team(leaders(showOnPreview(leaderCategories=[homeRuns,runsBattedIn,battingAverage],statGroup=[pitching,hitting]))),linescore(matchup,runners),flags,liveLookin,review,broadcasts(all),decisions,person,probablePitcher,stats,homeRuns,previousPlay,game(content(media(featured,epg),summary),tickets),seriesStatus(useOverride=true)&useLatestGames=false&scheduleTypes=events,games&language=en&leagueIds=103,104,420. In order to get conditions that are indicative of game statuses we'd like to test (at least one of each Live, Preview, Final), we'll keep the same date.  All of the games in the MLB on this date will be Regular Season.
custom_test_purpose: Just check against any game during the regular season period, make sure that it's identified as such.
custom_steps: Send GET request
custom_expected: Status 200, filter all games by mlb, check game type, all games will be of type "R"

title: Scoreboard - Game Type Spring Training
custom_preconds: We'll send our standard request:  https://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/schedule?sportId=1,51&date=2020-02-22&gameTypes=E,S,R,A,F,D,L,W&hydrate=team(leaders(showOnPreview(leaderCategories=[homeRuns,runsBattedIn,battingAverage],statGroup=[pitching,hitting]))),linescore(matchup,runners),flags,liveLookin,review,broadcasts(all),decisions,person,probablePitcher,stats,homeRuns,previousPlay,game(content(media(featured,epg),summary),tickets),seriesStatus(useOverride=true)&useLatestGames=false&scheduleTypes=events,games&language=en&leagueIds=103,104,420. In order to get conditions that are We'll focus on a timecode that will get us all three game types we want to test.  All of the games in the MLB on this date will be Spring Training.
